Articles.Content:
Ok, I'll bring two frigates (46 tons each) and one Callidus (201 tons).

Where should we fight?

Callidus' Stats:

Weight: 200.84 tons.

Length: 36 M

Weapons: 8 Anti-capital ship missiles, firing in pairs.

D/V: 4,200 m/s

TWR: 0.33

Picture:
Megalodon, take my fight, I can't get a fleet of 3 I'm happy with.

What's your fight?

EDIT: Also, the new SAS things next to the navball make me fell like I'm piloting an alien spacecraft.

EDITx2: Actually, come to think of it, I am piloting an alien spacecraft.

Edited December 26, 2014 by Megalodon 720

What's your fight?

One more Callidus(500, 3, duna)

http://www./download/kvnbhkur41489cs/persistent_(Eve1).sfs

2 Calliduses and 2 Frigates? I'm up for that.

Should I take my go once I've set up the persist?

Edited December 26, 2014 by Megalodon 720
Erm, I'd like to go 1st if you're bringing an extra ship. Its the same as you going 1st but with 3 ships, assuming things go to plan...

I was asking about Spartwo's battle.

Where should ours be? And don't worry, I'm only bringing 3 ships to our battle.

EDIT: Also Spartwo, you left this in low Eeloo orbit:P:

Edited December 27, 2014 by Megalodon 720

Erm, Spartwo meant for you to take over from him, and it was Eve, not Duna. I'd set up 3 ships at 500 tons (my fleet was around 550 tons with one showpiece dreadnought and 2 unarmoured cruisers). I'm happy to do something else if you prefer.

That's somebody else's ship at Eeloo, I left it there because I don't have the Sph file for it, delete if you want.
I know that ship...

Mageledon

Wow!! That's some smart lookin ships but where did you get that sky box?

Oh, cool to know. For our fight I was going to try to fix the struts on my new battleship since it's a bit more similar to the size of your ships. That'll take a bit of time. I'll try to get on it tomorrow morning before family comes over but I might not get it done because of preparations. Why don't you set up first for our battle, since I do have 0.25 working I will be able to open it no problem.

I'll set up my ships then.

Erm, Spartwo meant for you to take over from him, and it was Eve, not Duna. I'd set up 3 ships at 500 tons (my fleet was around 550 tons with one showpiece dreadnought and 2 unarmoured cruisers). I'm happy to do something else if you prefer.

That's somebody else's ship at Eeloo, I left it there because I don't have the Sph file for it, delete if you want.

So, I'm fighting you with 3 or 4 ships?

Mageledon

Wow!! That's some smart lookin ships but where did you get that sky box?

I got it here.

It's Overfloater's skybox.

So, I'm fighting you with 3 or 4 ships?

Well, My initial idea was a 3v3 but my ships are pretty massive so I agreed to let Spartwo bring an extra ship to make up the weight on the condition that I get to go 1st. Up to you; 3 ships if you want to go 1st, 4 if you are happy to let me go 1st.

All in all, I think bringing 4 ships gives you the biggest advantage as I have to spend fuel and ammo to bring it back to a 3v3 where I still shoot second..

I'll go 3v3, that sounds more fun.

So, was the persist that Spartwo gave me the one with your ships on it?
yeah, the 2 fireflies and Carnifex II are my ships, Ignore the Thraben and other debris...

Ok, I'll deorbit one of my Calliduses and move the other into a lower orbit.

After the crash the ship's hull was actually pretty intact, her crew had survived and many of her internals in her midsection and her bow were still there.

I'll take my turn now.

Edited December 27, 2014 by Megalodon 720

BATTLE UPDATE

The TCMS Obliquus waits for one of the Fireflies to come to it's periapsis, then it rendezvoused with it and fired.

Her first pair of I-beams miss.

The second pair hit, but only hit the little bit at the front, it seems that only minor damage was done. The third shot, an SRB missile, misses.

Persist

BATTLE UPDATE

The TCMS Obliquus waits for one of the Fireflies to come to it's periapsis, then it rendezvoused with it and fired.

Her first pair of I-beams miss.

http://i.imgur.com/AUHJmij.png

The second pair hit, but only hit the little bit at the front, it seems that only minor damage was done. The third shot, an SRB missile, misses.

Persist

Megalodon 720, your ships are not that accurate, what's the problem? did you place your core modules properly aligned with the armament? or is there something wrong in the weight distribution on your individual SRB's/SRM's when fired. (I had the same problem when I used radial decouplers for my SRB's/SRM's, it turns out that left over parts on the side has some weight that could throw out a well aimed shot. Even misplaced parts can do it or a minor force from the adjacent missile)

That was just shoddy aiming from me, the missiles actually fire very straight.

Also, I'm going to have to quit this battle, my frigates can barely scratch paint.

Edited December 27, 2014 by Megalodon 720
So, I think I'll be working on a fleet upgrade today, anyone care to do a little battle in the near future so I can test my ships?

That was just shoddy aiming from me, the missiles actually fire very straight.

Also, I'm going to have to quit this battle, my frigates can barely scratch paint.

Aww, I already took my turn. You killed that cruiser btw, being a showpiece the cockpit was actually the only pod apart from the ammo (see last screen).

Javascript is disabled. View full album

One all, if you want to continue, https://www./?zw4069n54qqp62z

Nah, I need better ships if I want to battle.

BUT! I now know, thanks to your turn, that the Callidus has two main weaknesses, she is easily immobilised and disarmed.

Here is the improvement I made on her weapon mounts, she is now harder to disarm:

As you can see, there is no longer a weak cubic strut holding the missiles on, but a very strong I-beam.

Here is the central spine which connects the ship's engines to the rest of the ship.

It is now covered by two layers of heavy armour.

Edited December 27, 2014 by Megalodon 720
Hey mega, I donwloaded your skybox but I ....... Don't know how to install it.....
You'll need texture replacer, when you have it, simply place the images in the 'Default' folder.
